laboratory_examinations.findings: Bilirubin 1.3 mg/dL (elevated), elevated LFTs and alkaline phosphatase (AP) levels with a finding of 65.0 IU/L (within normal range).
Presence of stones in the gallbladder and an 8.8mm common bile duct (CBD).
Multiple stones within the gallbladder including a 13-mm stone at the gallbladder neck, slight gallbladder wall edema, no hyperemia in the liver parenchyma, and no filling defects in the CBD.
